    default Many<ArenaResult>
    resultsByArenaId(String arenaId)
     
    Many<ArenaResult>
    resultsByArenaId(String arenaId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.ArenaResultParams> parameters)
    Players of an Arena tournament, with their score and performance, sorted by rank (best first).
    If called on an ongoing tournament, results can be inconsistent due to ranking changes while the players are being streamed.
    Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency.
    default Many<SwissResult>
    resultsBySwissId(String swissId)

    Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency.

    • withdrawArena

      Ack withdrawArena(String id)
      Leave a future Arena tournament, or take a break on an ongoing Arena tournament.
      It's possible to join again later. Points and streaks are preserved.
      Parameters:
      id - The tournament ID. Example: "hL7vMrFQ"

    • createSwiss

      One<Swiss> createSwiss(String teamId, Consumer<TournamentsApiAuth.SwissBuilder> params)

    • updateSwiss

      One<Swiss> updateSwiss(String id, Consumer<TournamentsApiAuth.SwissBuilder> params)
      Update a Swiss tournament.
      Be mindful not to make important changes to ongoing tournaments.
      Parameters:
      id - The tournament ID. Example: hL7vMrFQ
      params - Parameters of the tournament 
        String token = "..."; // token with scope tournament:write
  String swissId = "hL7vMrFQ";
  var client = Client.auth(token);
  client.tournaments().updateSwiss(swissId, params -> params.clock(300, 30).description("Another description"));

    • scheduleNextRoundSwiss

      Ack scheduleNextRoundSwiss(String id, ZonedDateTime date)
      Manually schedule the next round

      Manually schedule the next round date and time of a Swiss tournament.
      This sets the roundInterval field to 99999999, i.e. manual scheduling.
      All further rounds will need to be manually scheduled, unless the roundInterval field is changed back to automatic scheduling.

      Parameters:
      id - The tournament ID. Example: hL7vMrFQ
      date - The time to start the next round. Example: java.time.ZonedDateTime.now().plusMinutes(5)

    • scheduleNextRoundSwiss

      default Ack scheduleNextRoundSwiss(String id, UnaryOperator<ZonedDateTime> date)
      Manually schedule the next round

      Manually schedule the next round date and time of a Swiss tournament.
      This sets the roundInterval field to 99999999, i.e. manual scheduling.
      All further rounds will need to be manually scheduled, unless the roundInterval field is changed back to automatic scheduling.

      Parameters:
      id - The tournament ID. Example: hL7vMrFQ
      date - The time to start the next round. Example: now -> now.plusMinutes(5)

    • terminateSwiss

      Ack terminateSwiss(String swissId)

    • withdrawSwiss

      Ack withdrawSwiss(String id)
      Leave a future Swiss tournament, or take a break on an ongoing Swiss tournament. It's possible to join again later. Points are preserved.
      Parameters:
      id - The tournament ID. Example: "hL7vMrFQ"

    • joinSwiss

      Ack joinSwiss(String id, Consumer<TournamentsApiAuth.JoinSwissParams> params)

    • joinSwiss

      default Ack joinSwiss(String id)

    • generateUserEntryCodes

      default Map<String,String> generateUserEntryCodes(String tournamentEntryCode, Set<String> userIds)
      Generate user entry codes based on a tournament entry code, for a set of user ids.
      This way you can share the user specific entry codes without needing to share the tournament entry code.
      Parameters:
      tournamentEntryCode - , The tournament entry code.
      userIds - A set of user ids for whom you want to generate specific entry codes for.
      Returns:
      A map with user ids mapped to user entry codes.

    • generateUserEntryCode

      default String generateUserEntryCode(String tournamentEntryCode, String userId)
      Generate a user entry code based on a tournament entry code.
      This way you can share the user specific entry codes without needing to share the tournament entry code.
      Parameters:
      tournamentEntryCode - The tournament entry code.
      userId - The user id for whom you want to generate a specific entry code.
      Returns:
      A user specific entry code.
